newsitem.title: ETHIOPIA: Ethiopia charges former officials with killing 70.
newsitem.headline: Ethiopia charges former officials with killing 70.

text.p: Two former Ethiopian officials appeared in court on Thursday charged with killing 70 people during the Red Terror campaign of 1977 and 1978.
Prosecutors charged former police captain Abateneh Kassa, commander of Addis Ababa's First Police Station, with killing 39 prisoners.
Former Lieutenant-Commander Lemma Gutema, who administered central Shoa region, was charged with killing 31 people and causing harm to 569 whom he imprisoned without due process.
The two served under Marxist dictator Mengistu Haile Mariam's military junta, which killed up to 100,000 people in the Red Terror campaign against suspected opponents.
A total of 71 former officials of the Dergue, the junta that overthrew Emperor Haile Selassie in 1974 and ruled until 1991, are on trial charged with genocide and crimes against humanity.
